title: Operating Systems
ziele: Presentation of methods and principples of operating systems in a manufacturer-independent way.
lehrinhalte: Basics, classification, memory management, virtual memory, processes, PCB, CPU scheduling, parallelism, mutual exclusion, semaphors, deadlocks, event handling, disks, files and file systems, TCP/IP and networks, case study Unix/Linux, case study Windows XP.
literatur:
Basic literature:

  • Mühlbacher, J. R.; Betriebssysteme. Grundlagen. Schriftenreihe Informatik. Trauner Verlag, Linz, 2009.

Additional literature will be announced in each semester.
